## Nanopore embedding in microscale simulations (2025)
Worked on developing feasible algorithms for numerical simulations of micromaterials with embedded nanopores in three-dimensional space without sacrificing time and spatial performance. 
We accomplished this through existing meshing strategies consisting of adaptive refinement and coarsening, our mesh approximation algorithm, and bounding volume hierarchy (BVH) algorithms. 
<img src="Images/nanopore_full.png" style="height: 100%; width: 100%; object-fit: contain"/>

Digitally recreated foam from experiments. 
<img src="Images/foam_nano.png" style="height: 100%; width: 100%; object-fit: contain"/>


## Geometrical approximation of meshes (2025)
Constructed meshing reassignment algorithms to approximate complex porous regions and geometries. Achieved the following computational feats:


### Approximated geometries from without changing initial STL file
<img src="Images/sphere_approximation.png" style="height: 100%; width: 100%; object-fit: contain"/>

### Built systems architecture to automatically generate and run more than 850 simulations through clusters via HPC and cross-coding among Python, MATLAB, and COMSOL.
<img src="Images/architecture.png" style="height: 100%; width: 100%; object-fit: contain"/>

### Established computational validation and simulation equivalence between actual geometries and their counterpart mesh approximations.
<img src="Images/sphere_benchmark_equivalence.png" style="height: 100%; width: 100%; object-fit: contain"/>

### Beat benchmark simulation running time (219 seconds versus 18050 seconds) and RAM usage (24 GB versus 318 GB)
<img src="Images/running_time_sphere.png" style="height: 100%; width: 50%; object-fit: contain"/> <img src="Images/RAM_sphere.png" style="height: 100%; width: 50%; object-fit: contain"/>



## Modeling and simulation of coronary stents (2023)
In this project, we developed multi-domain modeling of coronary stents taking into account the full interplay among the wall, lumen, and struts through fluid-structure interactions.
